stats.title: Egypt [or Arab Republic of Egypt; or Jumhuriyat Misr al-Arabiyah]
People's Republic of China [or PRC; or Zhonghua renmin gongheguo; do not accept "Republic of China", "ROC" or "Taiwan"]
Paul (accept Rand Paul or Ron Paul)
Arab Republic of Egypt [or al-Jumhuriyya al-Arabiyya al-Misriyya]
Apple Inc. (prompt on FoxConn if they buzz in the first sentence)
Syrian Arab Republic [or al-Jumhuriyya al-Arabiyya al-Suriyya]
Greenpeace [accept Don't Make a Wave Committee before it is mentioned]
Mexican drug cartels [or cárteles; prompt on "Mexican criminal organizations" or any answer that does not specifically mention cartels]
filibuster (prompt on speech or things like "speeches given in a Senate")
fracking (accept induced hydraulic fracturing or hydrofracturing)
the 2013 Papal conclave [prompt on any answer related to "selecting a Pope" that does not include the word "conclave"]

Rand Paul's filibuster [or any answer that mentions Rand Paul and a filibuster and does not include incorrect information; accept descriptions including but not limited to "filibuster of John Brennan" or "filibuster regarding drones"; prompt on partial answers, including prompting if no first name is given, as Rand Paul is required to distinguish from "Ron Paul," which is incorrect if given]
Democratic Party of Wisconsin [or anything reasonable that contains Wisconsin and a form of the word Democrat; prompt on partial answer]
Italy [or Italian Republic or Repubblica Italiana]
voting [or electing; accept word forms; generously accept logical equivalents]
John Roberts (prompt on Chief Justice (of the U.S. Supreme Court) before mentioned)
The Sims (accept The Sims Online, The Sims Social, The Sims 2, or The Sims 3; do not accept references to any other EA Sim games, including but not limited to SimCity, SimGolf, or SimCopter)
Initial Public Offering of Facebook, Inc. (all underlined portions required; accept IPO of Facebook.com; prompt on IPO; prompt on equivalents for IPO such as "Facebook going public")
Bashar al-Assad (prompt on just Assad before "Hafez" is read; accept afterwards)
Pope Francis I (or Jorge Mario Bergoglio; prompt on "the Pope" before end)
Alexander Grigoryevich Lukashenko [or Alyaksandr Ryhoravich Lukashenka]
NFL replacement referees [accept equivalents; prompt on partial answer]
the September 11, 2012 attacks on the Benghazi consulate [or any same-knowledge equivalents; ask for less specificity on "the death of Ambassador Chris Stevens"]
Islamic Republic of Pakistan [or Islami Jumhuriya-e-Pakistan]
Lance Armstrong [or Lance Gunderson; or Lance Armstrong followed by any invective that the moderator finds appropriate for the situation]
Recep Tayyip Erdogan [ER-do-WAN, but be extremely lenient on pronunciation]
Barack Hussein Obama II's second inaugural address [accept word forms of inaugural]
United States Department of State [or U.S. State Department; or Department of State of the United States of America; accept equivalents]
Buffett Rule [accept Paying a Fair Share Act until mention, prompt after; prompt on things like "millionaire's tax", "taxing the rich", etc.]
Newton Leroy "Newt" Gingrich [or Newton Leroy McPherson]
Malala Yousafzai (accept Malala Yousaf; prompt on "Malala")
Defense of Marriage Act (accept "Law" or "Bill" for "Act;" prompt on "DOMA" before mention)
2014 referendum on Scottish independence (accept anything relating to a vote on whether Scotland should become independent from the United Kingdom (or (Great) Britain); prompt on partial answers)
U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (accept VA)
girls' education [or women's education; or female education; prompt on education; prompt on female empowerment]
charter schools [or charters, do not accept or prompt on "schools"]
Union of Burma [or Republic of the Union of Myanmar]
medical hospitals [or Veterans Affairs hospitals; or VA hospitals]
attack on the US Diplomatic Mission in Libya on September 11, 2012 [Accept logical equivalents involving Benghazi and some sort of attack
Federal Republic of Germany [or Bundesrepublik Deutschland]
shooting down an aircraft [accept synonyms and word forms; prompt on "plane crash"; accept helicopter for aircraft]
women [or girls; accept synonyms and reasonable equivalents like females, etc.]
Scotland [anti-prompt on "United Kingdom" or "UK" before mentioned]
egalization of marijuana [Accept equivalents, including ones substituting cannabis for marijuana.]
National Security Agency [or NSA; accept National Security Agency after "agency"]

the Royal Baby [or Prince George Alexander Louis of Cambridge; or the Prince of Cambridge; or George Alexander Louis Mountbatten-Windsor; prompt on "Cambridge"; prompt on "Windsor"; prompt on "Mountbatten-Windsor"]
plane crashes [accept clear knowledge equivalents, do not accept "plane disappearances"]
same-sex marriage [accept clear knowledge equivalents; prompt on marriage and equivalents]

: Benjamin Netanyahu's 2015 speech to a joint session of Congress [or Benjamin Netanyahu's third speech to a joint session of the US Congress; or Bibi Netanyahu's March 3rd, 2015 Congressional Speech; accept any answer indicating both Netanyahu and a speech given to Congress]
GMOs [or genetically modified organisms; or genetically modified crops; or GMO crops; or GMO plants; or GMO alfalfa]
Boko Haram [or Jama'atu Ahlis Sunna Lidda'Awati Wal-Jihad; or Wilayat al Sudan al Gharbi]
Koch [or David H. Koch; or Ed Koch; or Charles Koch; accept pronunciations that sound like "Cock", "Coke" or "Cook"]
Scottish National Party [or SNP; or Partaidh Naiseanta na h-Alba; or Scots Naitional Pairtie]
New Zealand [or Aotearoa from any Maoris]
Speaker of the House of Representatives [accept variations like "house speaker"; prompt on "congressman" or "representative" until "predecessor"]
Keystone XL Pipeline system [prompt answers such as "pipeline across America" until they give the specific answer]
The Paris Conference on Climate Change [or COP21; or CMP11; or the 2015 U.N. Climate Change Conference; prompt on partial answer]
UNESCO [or United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization]
Bill de Blasio [or Bill Wilhelm or Warren Wilhelm Jr.]
Yemeni Civil War [accept answers indicating a civil conflict in Yemen]
Republic of Colombia [or República de Colombia]
South Korea [accept Republic of Korea and prompt on Korea. DO NOT ACCEPT the "Democratic People's Republic of Korea" or "DPRK"]

killing Osama bin Laden [or assassination of Osama bin Laden; accept Operation Neptune Spear; accept anything involving the death of Osama bin Laden; accept Usama bin Laden in place of Osama bin Laden]
Federative Republic of  Brazil  [or República Federativa do  Brasil ]

tweet s by Donald (John)  Trump  [or  tweet s from @ realDonaldTrump ; prompt on  tweet s; prompt on statements made by Donald  Trump ] [The first mentioned tweet claims that Trump would rather "build walls than cling to them".]
